page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW-BARGOED AREA.
page.content: Map area dominated by township of Bargoed and smaller neighbours,Gilfach and Aberbargoed. Name derivation? Welsh word for boundary is bargod. Until 1974 boundary between Glamorgan and Monmouthshire was the Rhymney River running from north to south almost parallel with main road and railway. Typical valley mining communities, nestling in extreme east of Mid Glamorgan. Rows of miners' terraced houses situated along steep hillsides above river. Growth of area due to coal. Most of land cover outside communities is moorland and heath, uncultivated. Some enclosed land for rough grazing. Throughout valley derelict land reclamation schemes restoring greenery destroyed by industrial revolution.
